root.message: All metadata fields for the indicator 9-3-1, translated into en
root.data: Objective 9. Build a resilient infrastructure, promote sustainable industrialization that benefits everyone and encourage innovation9.3 Increase, especially in developing countries, the access of enterprises, especially small industrial enterprises, to financial services, including loans on affordable terms, and their integration into value chains and markets9.3.1 Proportion of small businesses in total industry value addedThe proportion of "small firms" in total industry value added represents the share of manufacturing value added of small manufacturing firms in total manufacturing value added. A company is the smallest legal unit that constitutes an organizational unit producing goods or services. Industrial enterprises are classified as small versus large or medium-sized for their distinct nature of economic organization, production capacity, scale of investment, and other economic characteristics.Share of small business value added in total industry value addedNot available
